articles.author: Samuel Haig
articles.description:
South Korean authorities have formed an emergency financial crimes unit to investigate the collapse of stablecoin protocol Terra, and fined the protocol’s founder, Do Kwon, $78M for tax evasion, local media reported. The government agencies want to understand why UST, Terra’s US dollar stablecoin, lost its peg on May 9. The crash wiped $18 billion …
  Terra Founder Faces Government Investigations, Lawsuits, and $78M Fine for Tax Evasion Read More »
articles.title: Terra Founder Faces Government Investigations, Lawsuits, and $78M Fine for Tax Evasion

articles.author: Samuel Haig
articles.description: Traders have taken advantage of the Fantom-based lending protocol having hard-coded fUSD and DEI at $1 despite the tokens trading below their pegs.
articles.title: Fantom’s SCREAM Falls 50% After Algorithmic Stablecoins Cause Bad Debt

articles.author: Owen Fernau
articles.description: The market capitalization of dollar-pegged stablecoins has dropped by $25B in the wake of Terra's collapse.
articles.title: Frax Founder Pins $25B Stablecoin Supply Drop on Fed Rate Hikes

articles.author: Aleksandar Gilbert
articles.description:
Crypto markets have stabilized, ending a market free-fall that erased $693B from crypto’s market capitalization from May 5 to May 12. Crypto’s market capitalization fell from $1.81T on May 5 to lows of $1.12T on May 12. The market started to rise on Friday, and now rests at $1.28T, data from CoinMarketCap shows. The crash …
  Crypto Markets Stabilize After $693B Sell-Off Read More »
articles.title: Crypto Markets Stabilize After $693B Sell-Off
